Sentence.sentence: You can see that we're here to stay, said Vladimir Cheberdak, 57, chief of the Bellingshausen Station, as he sipped tea under a portrait of Fabian Gottlieb von Bellingshausen, a high-ranking officer in the Imperial Russian Navy who explored the Antarctic coast in 1820.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: With several monitoring stations operating in Antarctica, Russia is trying hard to counter America's dominance in the field of worldwide navigational facilities.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: To be sure, the battery still has a long way to go before the nightly recharge completely replaces the weekly  trip to the gas station.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The research stations on King George lsland offer a glimpse into the long game on this ice-blanketed continent as nations assert themselves, eroding the sway long held by countries like the United States, Britain, Australia and New Zealand.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Less than an hour away by snowmobile, Chinese labourers have updated the Great Wall Station, a vital part of China's plan to operate five bases on Antarctica, complete with an indoor badminton court and sleeping quarters for 150 people.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It opened its fourth station last year and is pressing ahead with plans to build a fifth.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: However, Brazil's stretch of misfortune has created opportunities for China, with a Chinese company winning the $100 million contract in 2015 to rebuild the Brazilian station.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: China's newly renovated Great Wall Station on King George Island makes the Russian and Chilean bases here seem outdated.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Building on a Soviet-era foothold, Russia is expanding its monitoring stations for Glonass, its version of the Global Positioning System ( ' , GPS).
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Brazil opened a research station in 1984, but it was largely destroyed by a fire that killed two members of the navy in 2012, the same year that a diesel-laden Brazilian barge sank near the base.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Being stationed in Antarctica involves adapting to life on the planet's driest, windiest and coldest continent, yet each nation manages to make itself at home.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: At least three Russian stations are already operating in Antarctica, part of its effort to challenge the dominance of the American GPS, and new stations are planned for sites like the Russian base, in the shadow of the Orthodox Church of the Holy Trinity.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: As some countries expand operations in Antarctica, the United States maintains three year-round stations on the continent with more than 1,000 people during the southern hemisphere's summer, including those at the Amundsen-Scott station, built in 1956 at an elevation of 9,301 feet on a plateau at the South Pole.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It’s no accident that most gas station shave convenience stores attached.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Agencies often produce alternative ads or commercials that are pre-tested in newspapers, television stations, etc.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: She worked at a radio station for a year, always aware that her body was degenerating.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: After three years of working in a petrol station and doing unpaid work I still hadn't managed to get an entry level job.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section A

Sentence.sentence: As some countries expand operations in Antarctica, the United States maintains three year-round stations on the continent with more than 1,000 people during the southern hemisphere's summer, including those at the Amundsen-Scott station, built in 1956 at
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: China's newly renovated Great Wall Station on king George Island makes the Russian and Chilean bases here seem outdated.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: To be sure, the battery still has a long way to go before the nightly recharge completely replaces the weekly trip to the gas station.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均可表示"站"之意。
means: station ： 普通用词，一般指火车站或汽车站。
stop ： 多指公共汽车站，尤指中途停车站。
terminal ： 指火车、公共汽车或飞机的终点(总)站。

stems_affixes.word_buile: station位置,岗位+ary……的→adj.静止的,固定的
apo离开+stat站,立+e→n.背教者,变节者

stems_affixes.value_cn: 房地产;不动产;所有权;地位;生活状况
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+stat站,立+e→站出来的东西→房子等不动产
state陈述,说明+ment表名词→n.声明,陈述
stat站,立+ion表名词→立着不动→位置,岗位
stat站,立+istic学科+s→站着[静态]的学科→统计
stat站,立+ure表名词→站着的状态→身高,身材
stat站,立+us→人立于社会的情形→地位,身份

stems_affixes.value_cn: 成文法,法令,法规;章程,规则,条例
stems_affixes.word_buile: stat站,立+ute→站着不能动→法令,法规

word_mean: 姿势：站立的姿势和习惯，在共济失调时可能成为特异性诊断体征。见attitude项下
产位：胎儿在产道中先露部位的定位，按其在坐骨棘假定平面上的厘米数定为－5～－1，处于坐骨棘假定平面上时为0，先露部位在坐骨棘平面下方的厘米数定为＋1～＋5
救护站，救护所：病人或伤员停留的特定场所
测量时设置仪器的点位。

entry.def: A station is a building by a railway line where trains stop so that people can get on or off.

example.ex: Ingrid went with him to the railway station to see him off...
example.tran: 英格丽德和他一起去火车站送他。

example.ex: Businessmen stream into one of Tokyo's main train stations.
example.tran: 商人不断涌进东京的一个主要火车站。

entry.def: A bus station is a building, usually in a town or city, where buses stop, usually for a while, so that people can get on or off.
If you talk about a particular radio or television station, you are referring to the programmes broadcast by a particular radio or television company.

example.ex: It claims to be the most popular television station in the UK.
example.tran: 它自称是英国最受欢迎的电视台。

entry.def: If soldiers or officials are stationed in a place, they are sent there to do a job or to work for a period of time.
entry.tran: 安置,派驻(士兵或官员);使驻扎

example.ex: Reports from the capital, Lome, say troops are stationed on the streets...
example.tran: 来自首都洛美的报道称，部队驻扎在大街上。

example.ex: I was stationed there just after the war.
example.tran: 战争刚结束，我就被派驻到那里。

entry.def: If you station yourself somewhere, you go there and wait, usually for a particular purpose.
entry.tran: (常指为某一特定目的)在…守候

example.ex: The musicians stationed themselves quickly on either side of the stairs...
example.tran: 乐师们很快就静候在了楼梯的两边。

example.ex: He stationed himself at the door.

means.word_mean: 1. a facility equipped with special equipment and personnel for a particular purpose;

sentences.sentence: "he started looking for a gas station"
"the responsibilities of a man in his station"

means.word_mean: 3. (nautical) the location to which a ship or fleet is assigned for duty
4. the position where someone (as a guard or sentry) stands or is assigned to stand;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a noun): via Old French from Latin statio(n-), from stare 'to stand'. Early use referred generally to ‘position’, especially 'position in life, status', and specifically, in ecclesiastical use, to 'a holy place of pilgrimage (visited as one of a succession'). The verb dates from the late 16th cent

Sentence.sentence: That approach will eliminate most cord-cutting concerns—but what about their wireless equivalent, jamming? With the right device tuned to the right frequency, what's to stop a thief from jamming your setup and blocking that alert signal from ever reaching the base station?Jamming concerns are nothing new, and they're not unique to security systems.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文
